info.game_comments:
2001 Holiday Kids Week game 3.

(Sarah: This is Sarah of the Clue Crew.  Take a free trip to Sea World with us on Jeopardy!)

jeopardy_round: FILL IN THE BLANK STATE NICKNAMES

(2, 1).clue: These have great seedsyou can eat

(3, 1).clue: You won't have to go to school except for meetings of the PTA the association of these 2 groups

(6, 1).clue: It's the branch of the Boy Scouts for kids 7 to 10

(2, 2).clue: It's the generic termfor the flowers that bloomon the plant seen here

(3, 2).clue: As a natural-born citizen, when you're 35 you can run for this cush job now filled by number 43

(4, 2).clue: This doctor who can speak to animals practices in the town of Puddleby-on-the-Marsh

(5, 2).clue: Jake Lloyd lit up the screen as young Anakin Skywalker in "Star Wars: Episode I", also known as this

(6, 2).clue: It's the compartment in an airplane where the pilot & other crew members sit

(2, 3).clue: These are actually native to Asia, though they're more popularly seen near windmills

(3, 3).clue: There's a form called the 1040 which you'll send to this government agency with your taxes

(5, 3).clue: Seen here, Taylor Momsen playedthis member of the Who family in "How the GrinchStole Christmas"

(2, 4).clue: Dorothy fell asleepin a field of thesewhile off to see the Wizard

(3, 4).clue: You'll want a car but unless gas prices go down you'll want one that gets good MPG, which stands for this

(5, 4).clue: Alexa Vega & Daryl Sabara played the children of secret agents in this 2001 film

(6, 4).clue: From a French word meaning "to disguise", this type of military fabric is used to blend in with surroundings

(2, 5).clue: These flowers might put you in the holiday spirit

(3, 5).clue: You'll learn all about busy-work when you fill out forms for your HMO, this kind of "maintenance organization"

(4, 5).clue: In books by Garth Nix, the only place that gets sun is a castle city with this title number of towers

(6, 5).clue: An example of one of these family heraldic emblems is seen here

(1, 1).clue: In 1799 Col. Henry Lee eulogized this President as "First in war, first in peace & first in the hearts of his countrymen"

(2, 1).clue: Joseph was the founder of the Mormon religion & Will is the Fresh Prince of hip hop

(3, 1).clue: Rollin', rollin', rollin'...like cattle, a group of walruses is called this

(4, 1).clue: Shikoku, the smallest of this country's 4 main islands, is also its least populous

(5, 1).clue: A virtual museum on the web is devoted to 100 years of these devices that apply radiant heat to slices of bread

(6, 1).clue: "A spot of" this beverage is produced by steeping leaves in freshly boiled water

(1, 2).clue: Boxing Day began in the Middle Ages when lords in this island nation gave gifts to their servants on Dec. 26

(2, 2).clue: Daniel performed the first successful open heart surgery & Robin was absent-minded in "Flubber"

(3, 2).clue: For centuries sailors have thought these sea animals swimming near a ship was a lucky sign

(4, 2).clue: The Denmark Strait separates Iceland from this much larger island

(5, 2).clue: The Shrine of the Book, which houses the Dead Sea Scrolls, is a wing of this country's national museum

(1, 3).clue: Mao Tse Tung, a leader of this country, began his "Long March" through life on Dec. 26, 1893

(2, 3).clue: John Paul was a Revolutionary War naval hero & James Earl was the voice of Mufasa in "The Lion King"

(3, 3).clue: Common in Australia, this type of shark named for a striped feline can be 15 feet long

(4, 3).clue: Trinacria was the ancient name for this island off the tip of Italy's "toe"

(6, 3).clue: In the names of diseases, it follows small & chicken

(1, 4).clue: In 1994 "The Glass Menagerie" broke for the first time in public at the Civic Theatre in this "Windy City"

(2, 4).clue: Jefferson ran the Confederate States & Al runs the Oakland Raiders

(3, 4).clue: (Sarah of the Clue Crew holding an Arctic animal.) This sly guy, an Arctic one of these, has smaller ears to keep him from losing too much body heat

(4, 4).clue: This string of islands extends westward about 1,200 miles from the Alaskan peninsula

(5, 4).clue: This London museum's Department of Egyptian Antiquities houses the Rosetta Stone

(6, 4).clue: A pledge or promise, such as one made during a wedding ceremony

(1, 5).clue: On Dec. 26, 1989 this woman scientist & her husband Pierre discovered radium

(2, 5).clue: Andrew was the first President to be impeached & Michael is an Olympic gold medal track & field runner

(5, 5).clue: The Astronaut Hall of Fame in Titusville, Florida honors several heroes including this first American in space
